title: PLAZA / GRAFFITO
description:
There's a giant graffito on the plaza outside:
Un jour je serai de retour pr√®s de toi

dialogueTree.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The graffito has been painted over..."
dialogueTree.text: The graffito has been painted over the traces of the fight that took place here. It smells of blood and heavy fuel oil.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This was Cindy the SKULL."
links.text: This was Cindy the SKULL.

links.title: You: "Looks like Cindy the SKULL has been..."
links.text: Looks like Cindy the SKULL has been here.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant crouches, touching t..."
links.text: The lieutenant crouches, touching the fuel oil with his finger.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or some other hoodlum. This is sti..."
links.text: "Or some other hoodlum. This is still fresh. It wasn't here yesterday."

links.title: Conceptualization: "The Return..."
links.text: The Return...

links.title: You: ""Does this have anything to do with..."
links.text: "Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje was waiting for?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could be. In Revachol West, someon..."
links.text: "Could be. In Revachol West, someone somewhere is always whispering about Le Retour..." He squints his eyes at the writing. "It's an *aerograffito*, meant for Coalition aerostatics in the lower troposphere."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The return to her side."
links.text: The return to her side.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Spoken as the something that will o..."
links.text: Spoken as the something that will one day return? Or as the someone who's waiting?

links.title: You: ""Does this have anything to do with..."
links.text: "Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje is waiting for?"

links.title: You: "Does this have anything to do with'..."
links.text: Does this have anything to do with' The Return' Klaasje was waiting for?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of what and to whom, you think? Spo..."
links.text: Of what and to whom, you think? Spoken as the something that will one day return? Or as the someone who's waiting?

links.title: You: "Does this have anything to do with..."
links.text: Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje is waiting for?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Fresh blood. The return to her side..."
links.text: Fresh blood. The return to her side.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The return of light."
links.text: The return of light.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The red-dyed fuel oil glistens. Thi..."
links.text: The red-dyed fuel oil glistens. This was painted very recently.

links.title: You: "Looks like Cindy the SKULL finally..."
links.text: Looks like Cindy the SKULL finally found the words for her masterpiece.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant crouches, touching t..."
links.text: The lieutenant crouches, touching the fuel oil with his finger.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it, yes. This is still..."
links.text: "Looks like it, yes. This is still fresh. It wasn't here yesterday."

links.title: You: "I smell heavy fuel oil."
links.text: I smell heavy fuel oil.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And blood. Some of it is even your..."
links.text: "And blood. Some of it is even yours."

links.title: Interfacing: "Heavy fuel oil -- isn't that... fla..."
links.text: Heavy fuel oil -- isn't that... flammable?

links.title: You: "What are you trying to imply, finge..."
links.text: What are you trying to imply, fingers?

links.title: Interfacing: "You *could* buy some smokes, light..."
links.text: You *could* buy some smokes, light up a ciggy and throw it in there... You know, just to see what happens. See if it's flammable. It's better that way. Safer.

links.title: You: "No. Nope. No-no-no, bad idea."
links.text: No. Nope. No-no-no, bad idea.

links.title: Interfacing: "Okay. Sorry. Hooh. Close call."
links.text: Okay. Sorry. Hooh. Close call.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "And blood. Some of it may even be y..."
links.text: And blood. Some of it may even be yours. Looks like a giant mop was used to turn it into lettering...

links.title: You: ""Step back, lieutenant." (Set the g..."
links.text: "Step back, lieutenant." (Set the graffito on fire with a lit cigarette.)

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The fuel oil catches fire immediate..."
links.text: The fuel oil catches fire immediately with an ominous hiss -- a bright orange flash across the surface of the letters. Black smoke rises from the burning message.

links.title: Inland Empire: "What if the words are not directed..."
links.text: What if the words are not directed at the people of Martinaise, or even the Coalition aerostatics above the city -- they're meant for something above even those...

links.title: You: ""DISCO ELYSIUM.""
links.text: "DISCO ELYSIUM."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant has taken a small st..."
links.text: The lieutenant has taken a small step back. He looks at your face illuminated by the flames and nods silently. Then the fire falters...

links.title: Empathy: "The flames warmed him too. Not at a..."
links.text: The flames warmed him too. Not at all in a bad way.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go to that island.""
links.text: "Let's go to that island."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Time to crack this case. Let's rea..."
links.text: "Time to crack this case. Let's really, really have a close look at that window in Klaasje's room."

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The flames warm your face. Then --..."
links.text: The flames warm your face. Then -- a gust of cold wind, and the fire falters...

links.title: Shivers: "IT'S TIME TO GO TO THE ISLAND."
links.text: IT'S TIME TO GO TO THE ISLAND.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "Slowly the flames subside, the fuel..."
links.text: Slowly the flames subside, the fuel burning out. The air still smells of mazut -- and springtime.

links.title: Logic: "It's time to crack this case. The n..."
links.text: It's time to crack this case. The next logical move is to go back upstairs, to Klaasje's room. Really inspect that window.

links.title: You: ""YOU'VE BEEN POLICED, MARTINAISE.""
links.text: "YOU'VE BEEN POLICED, MARTINAISE."

links.title: You: ""GOD. I'M ON MY WAY.""
links.text: "GOD. I'M ON MY WAY."

links.title: You: "Say nothing. Stare grimly into the..."
links.text: Say nothing. Stare grimly into the flames.

links.title: You: "Set the graffito on fire with a lit..."
links.text: Set the graffito on fire with a lit cigarette.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
